post.body:
Announcing I2P+, an enhanced version of I2P with greater emphasis on usability and presentation.

More information: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/ or http://skank.i2p/static/i2p+.html

Changelog: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/changelog.txt

0.9.40-5+ now available, with enhanced sybil detection and the option to automatically block detected sybils.  magnet:?xt=urn:btih:0c8439678d0b562842ad610c75ac57ac0fd3565c (I2P-capable BitTorrent client required)

I2P+ supports theme overrides for customizing console and I2PSnark themes. Have a look in i2p/docs/themes/console/<theme-dir> and i2p/docs/themes/snark/<theme-dir> for some examples of overrides. The override must be named override.css in order to activate it. Once activated, the override will persist after router updates.

I2P+ supports up to 16 inbound and outbound tunnels in I2PSnark, which can significantly speed up torrent downloads. After the initial tunnel setup, the tunnels are dynamically allocated as needed, so you'll never use more tunnels than you have connected peers.

0.9.40-7+ now available, featuring a major overhaul of the Tunnel Manager which improves presentation and space efficiency.
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:d99f189d997f6b7a7ad4fae075554949531ce3ab (I2P-capable BitTorrent client required)

0.9.40-8+ now available, with new automatic 15s ajax refresh for  the Tunnel Manager index page, /jobs and /tunnels.
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:db3cf6d465da8a0698f1a676b233b34dca642c5b (I2P-capable BitTorrent client required)

0.9.40-12+ now shipping, with ajax refresh and stabilization for performance graphs.
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:b87012d3913a597ab888e825a192ce36380a6df2 (I2P-capable BitTorrent client required)

0.9.41+ now available, featuring dynamic ajax updates for /jobs, /tunnels, /logs, /graphs and the tunnel manager index, in addition to improved rendering of performance graphs.
magnet:?xt=urn:btih:f9577dbaae1fe991055adfcc90b50ba74b91edbe
(I2P-capable BitTorrent client required)
More information: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/ or http://skank.i2p/static/i2p+.html
Changelog: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/changelog.txt

0.9.42+ now available, featuring performance enhancing patches and user interface improvements.
More information: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/ or http://skank.i2p/static/i2p+.html
Changelog: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/changelog.txt

0.9.43+ now available, featuring a new I2P-specific glossary in the help section, and various UI improvements.
More information: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/ or http://skank.i2p/static/i2p+.html
Changelog: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/changelog.txt

"Charcoal" override.css file now available for the light I2P+ console theme. Next I2P+ release will include override options for Susimail, SusiDNS and the Tunnel Manager. Download: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/misc/override.css.charcoal
Source now available on Gitlab: https://gitlab.com/i2pplus/I2P.Plus

I2P+ 0.9.47+ released!

Announcing the latest release of I2P+ (0.9.47+), a soft-fork of the Java I2P software with an emphasis on presentation, performance, and usability.

Now available for download as an update or a full installer for Windows and Linux:

  *  Torrents: http://tracker2.postman.i2p/index.php?view=TPoolDetail&id=1256
  *  Direct downloads via https://i2pplus.com/ or http://fhiqjkax7s6cs2shcozpnnq6v64txoovuczw62lpj4jfbiisrkzw5vid.onion/
  *  Git source access: https://gitlab.com/i2p.plus/I2P.Plus/

Some of the recent changes include:
  *  Updates to console icons and flags
  *  Realtime updates for I2PSnark bandwidth and ETA readouts
  *  SusiDNS user interface improvements
  *  Improvements to the eephead tool with support for most server header fields
  *  Enhanced presentation of 'random art' in the Imagegen webapp
  *  Updates to console and webapp themes

More information:
  *  I2P: http://skank.i2p/
  *  Clearnet Mirror: http://i2pplus.com
  *  Zeronet: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18UDHQbfX1A388SKvPHxXB1ZGFu9uRy1Kh/
  *  Tor .onion: http://fhiqjkax7s6cs2shcozpnnq6v64txoovuczw62lpj4jfbiisrkzw5vid.onion/

Note: The full installers now implement https:// access to the console by default; you will need to allow the (self-signed) certificate when prompted in your web browser to access the console.

To disable automatic redirection from http (port 7657) to https (port 7667), add the following to your router.config file in ~/.i2p/ or %APPDATA%\I2P\ -> routerconsole.redirectToHTTPS=false

Additionally, for Windows users installing for the first time, the start/stop service links may need to be run with administrator privileges.

Announcing the latest release of I2P+ (0.9.48+), a soft-fork of the Java I2P software with an emphasis on presentation, performance, and usability.

Now available for download as an update or a full installer for Windows and Linux:

* Torrents: http://tracker2.postman.i2p/index.php?view=TPoolDetail&id=1256
* Direct downloads via https://i2pplus.com/ or http://fhiqjkax7s6cs2shcozpnnq6v64txoovuczw62lpj4jfbiisrkzw5vid.onion/
* Git source access: https://gitlab.com/i2pplus/I2P.Plus/

Some of the recent changes include:

* New enhanced refresh mechanism for console sidebar and torrents
* Automatic refresh for downloading files on torrent info page
* Add tooltip indicating share ratio and last activity to torrent upload column
* Improved presentation of leasesets in console network database section
* Display encryption and signature type on tunnel manager index page
* Enhanced terminal output for eepget, i2ping and eephead
* Custom icon for I2Ping under sidebar Service Tunnels section
* Increase maximum size of graphs to 8K (7680 x 4320)
* Console and webapp theme improvements

Notes: 
* The full installers now implement https:// access to the console by default; you will need to allow the (self-signed) certificate when prompted in your web browser to access the console. To disable automatic redirection, add the following to your router.config file in ~/.i2p/ -> routerconsole.redirectToHTTPS=false
* The Windows installer will install I2P+ as a Windows system service and configure to automatically start at system boot (requires administrator privileges). Control of the service can be managed via http://127.0.0.1:7657/configservice or via the normal Windows methods e.g. services.msc or the task manager services tab.

Announcing the latest release of I2P+ (0.9.49+), a soft-fork of the Java I2P software with an emphasis on presentation, performance, and usability.

Now available for download as an update or a full installer for Windows and Linux (Java 1.8 or later supported):

* Torrents: http://tracker2.postman.i2p/index.php?view=TPoolDetail&id=1256
* Direct downloads via http://skank.i2p/ | https://i2pplus.github.io/ | http://3d4sqxazwhmc2djwwiqpa4sbmpxpra6ta2qn3o4r4zsmly3obliqbqid.onion/
* Git source access: https://gitlab.com/i2p.plus/I2P.Plus/

Some of the recent changes include:
* New mechanism to select routers for local tunnels based on measured latency
* Additional sidebar readouts to indicate tunnel build concurrency and average build time, average tunnel lag, and optionally peer test average (enabled with routerconsole.showPeerTestAvg=true)
* Improvements to the i2ping, eephead and eepget scripts to enable argument and error handling
* Improvements to various sub-systems to prioritize server and client traffic
* For high bandwidth routers, better performance when hosting a large number of participating tunnels (14000 tunnels at 8MB/s both directions has been reported)
* New icons for router groups (fast, highcap, integrated, standard) on the peer profiles page
* Various UI improvements to optimize space usage and presentation
* Easier updates to I2P+ (both release and dev builds) within the console, with improved UI feedback when updates are available
* Ongoing improvements to console and webapp themes

Notes:
The full installers now implement https:// access to the console by default; you will need to allow the (self-signed) certificate when prompted in your web browser to access the console. To disable automatic redirection, add the following to your router.config file in ~/.i2p/ -> routerconsole.redirectToHTTPS=false

The Windows installer will install I2P+ as a Windows system service and configure to automatically start at system boot (requires administrator privileges). Control of the service can be managed via http://127.0.0.1:7657/configservice or via the normal Windows methods e.g. services.msc or the task manager services tab.

comment.body: @猫叉酱（小号）: There's been some initial work on integrating I2P with Zeronet, but apparently that's stalled. See: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/602
